block_comment: The block of Verilog code primarily handles data read and write operations based on the input address. It uses bitwise and logical operations to create write enable signals (`wea_b0` and `wea_b1`) which are contingent on the address bit [9] and the byte enable signal. Next, it uses a ternary operator to select `read_data_b0` or `read_data_b1` based on the value of `address_9_r`, effectively dealing with two byte addresses with a single line of code.
